name: simple-reminder
title: Simple Reminder
description: Set your reminders in natural language without the need to have any application installed.
author: comoser

commands.name: index
commands.title: Add Reminder
commands.description: Add a new reminder or check existing ones. You will be notified when the reminder time is reached.

commands.name: reminderNotifications
commands.title: Reminder System Notifications
commands.description: Background service to notify the user through a system notification when a reminder date is right up

commands.name: reminderMenuBar
commands.title: Reminder Menu Bar
commands.subtitle: Simple Reminder
commands.description: See your simple reminders in your macOS menu bar.

preferences.name: mobileNotificationNtfy
preferences.description: With this option turned on, you will receive notifications (through ntfy) in your mobile phone when a reminder time is up
preferences.label: Mobile notifications with ntfy

preferences.name: mobileNotificationNtfyTopic
preferences.description: Specify the topic you want to receive notifications in. Can be used for the default ntfy server or a self-hosted one
preferences.title: ntfy topic

preferences.name: mobileNotificationNtfyServerUrl
preferences.description: When ntfy mobile notifications are on, if this url is set (from a self-hosted ntfy server), it will be used to send the notification
preferences.placeholder: Only use this if you're using a self-hosted ntfy server
preferences.title: ntfy server url

preferences.name: mobileNotificationNtfyServerAccessToken
preferences.description: When ntfy mobile notifications are on and a self-hosted ntfy url is being used, this is the authentication access token to use to authenticate against the server
preferences.placeholder: Only use this if you're using a self-hosted ntfy server
preferences.title: ntfy server access token
